law.text: "Insurance" is a contract whereby one undertakes to pay or indemnify another as to loss from certain specified contingencies or perils called "risks," or to pay or grant a specified amount or determinable benefit or annuity in connection with ascertainable risk contingencies, or to act as surety.
law.history: Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 1, sec. 3, effective June 18, 1970.
